text:
Aroma:

Slight/medium aroma of malts, caramel, yeast, fruit, hops and spices.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque orange/brown beer with no/a slight off-white head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel, yeast and fruit; ends slightly bitter and dry with hops and spices.

Overall:

This beer is rather intense, complex and balanced. Good balanced flavours, that never gets truly great at any point. Same goes for the aroma, but the appearance and palate are great.

Headless cloudy amber. Aroma is basement with pear/apple. Not sure what is heather, honeysuckle or hyssop in it, but its got a hibiscus/rosewater-like thing going. Carbonation is champagne esque, but with more sweetness and body. Taste adds melon and botanicals (licorice?). Pleasant, drinkable, interesting.

Bottle 355 ml from Craftgallery - Bern (CH). Golden beer tending to amber, average and cream head, serene sparkling. Malted aromas, floral perfumes, marshmallow. The taste is fresh, very soft and mellow, with fragance of a flowerbed and barley sugar. Spiced notes, honey, cherry, pepper, lemon and orange/honeysuckle blossom. Peppery and grassy bitter.

$2.75 bottle from Wine Warehouse. Pours slightly hazy golden with no head. Aroma of honey, strawberry, melon. Flavor is sweet dark fruit, grain, burnt honey, perhaps a hint of orange. Interesting. Edited to add: as this beer warmed, the flavors burst out and I enjoyed it more. Bumping up overall by two points and taste by one.
Medium white head chestnut copper coloured body, fruity yeasts malts strawberry like smell, medium co2 medium bitter some sweet malts warming taste yeasts some hay like taste

Poured from a 12 oz bottle into a pint glass. The appearance is a murky bright golden yellow color with a medium sized off-white head. The aroma is sweet fruit and yeast with some grain added. The taste is very close to the nose. Did not work for me.
Bottle. Fruity and malty tones. Fruit, malt, spices and hops. Medium body with a nice bitter sweet finish.

Bottle from We Brought Beer Clapham Junction, London - UK. Color: hazy golden blond beer beer with small carbonation and medium white foam. Smell: sweet malt, saison and grassy notes. Caramel and bread with hay. Taste: medium body with caramel malt backbone. Saison and fruity balance. Good attenuation. Aftertaste: sweet and fruity, good bitterness.

Bottle. Moderate malt aromas of light bread, nutty and grain, light to moderate grass and herbs for the hops, moderate dough for the yeast, with dried light fruit and white wine and faint baking spice in the background. Head is large, frothy, slightly off-white, with some slippery lacing and is mostly lasting. Color is clear medium amber but hazy and has a few crumbs floating around. Flavor starts lightly sweet and acidic, then finishes lightly sweet, acidic and only slightly bitter. Palate is on the fuller side of medium, slick with a lively carbonation and a smooth and faintly alcoholic finish. What an exceptional Biere de Garde!

Bottle from Gambrinus. Pours a honeyed copper with almost no head. Saison yeast and honey on the nose with some light floral notes. Bready malt, honey and light lemongrass hops on the palate. Sweet on the palate. Light peppery finish.

hazy golden to orange colour, moderate sized off-white head; aroma of marmalade, apricot, carrot cake, floral-honey notes and rye bread; taste of syrupy-honey sweetness, overripe apricot, marmalade, carrot cake and some leather notes; great beer!

A golden beer, a head is small and white. Aroma has fruitness of perries, apple marmelade, flowers, some bananas hint of alcohol. Taste has perries, flowers, some spicyness of peppers, quite lots of sweetness. Medium bodied, smooth. Complex and interesting beer with lots of complex fruitness.

Bottle, pours hazy orange with almost no head. Floral and honey aroma with taste of orange peel and cloves.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Trübes Orange mit wenig Schaum. Malzig, süßlich, fruchtig, Aprikose, Zitrus, Honig, blumig, etwas Karamell, ein wenig Pfeffer, süffig.

Appearance: Orange golden, quite clear. Small amount of head.
Aroma: Fruit, lemon, honey.
Taste: Lots of fruit, sweetness, honey. Smooth. Lingering fruity aftertaste. Very nice.
Bought: Craft Gallery, 355 ml, CHF 5.90
Info: 13/8-2016, BB: 30/9-2016 (according to importer)

(Bottle) Golden amber colour with big, frothy, off.white head. Fruity, spicy nose with apricots, grapefruit, honey, a touch of clove and flowers. Fruity, spicy, floral taste with notes of bread, apricots, grapefruit, peppercorns, clove and honey. Medium body, with a certain sweetness, Low bitterness. Quite spicy and floral. Well balanced. Nice one.

0,33l bottle at home. No obvious BB date. orange hazy color, small white head. smells quite yeasty, spices, light nutty, honey, some ripe fruits. decent smell. medium to full body, rather light carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes belgian yeasty, fruity, peach, spices, light sweetness, honey. finishes with a very nice balance of light sweetness and spices. good one, smell not overly special but taste is light but quite refreshing, especially nice finish.

This was poured into a tulip.
The appearance was a subtle hazy burnt orange color with a thin white foamy head that quickly dissipated. Light lingering lacing runs around the glass nicely.
The smell starts off with some sweet honeysuckle, light floral (heather), subtle grassy sweetness. Slight sweet cherries. Light toast (with that good "butter" to it, not diacetyl)
The flavor brings everything together to produce a nice sticky sweetness running into the aftertaste with all previously mentioned flavors.
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium in body with a nice semi-sessionability about it. Carbonation runs fairly light. Decent for what it is.
Overall, good biere de garde. Pretty sure I could have again.

355ml bottle. Minimally cloudy, orangey golden colour with small, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Minimally vinous, bready malty and yeasty fruity aroma, notes of apricot and peach in both, fresh and dried condition, fruit cake, hints of custard, a touch of honey, floral hoppy overtones with a touch of chamomile. Taste is moderately sweet malty, fruity, apricot and peach again, caramel malt with a minimally yeasty doughy touch, hints of honey, a floral touch of chamomile: Rich and variegated, very well balanced, flattering for the palate.
Bottle at home. Bright murky orange, no head. Melon, sweet citrus with a hint of spice. Moderate sweet. Unique.

12 oz bottle. 246:14. From demolenbeershop.com.
Slightly cloudy bronze color with a tiny white head.
Sweetness, Belgian style yeast, caramel malt and some citrus in the aroma. 
The flavor is yeast, sweetness, citrus and some sweetish maltiness. Quite alright.

Soft golden orange pour with a thin off white head. Nose is malty ad sweet with some toasty and biscuity notes. Lite fruity notes in the flavor with a rustic and bready malt note. Sweet finish and medium body.
Pours a hazy yellowish/gold color. Aromas of tart fruit, bread, hint of citrus, and yeasty. Flavor is malty/citrus. Leaves a yeasty orange aftertaste.
Bottle. Golden pour with white head. Aromas are spice laden, honey, herbal and fruit aromas. Flavors are fruit, malty, honey, spice and yeast.

355 ml bottle.
Pours hazy orange color with a medium sized head. Surprisingly fruity aroma, apricot mostly, some herbal notes, earthy, faint grain, subtle wheaty spiciness too. Flavor is spicy and earthy, mild yeast notes, apricot. Strong carbonation, fluffy really, mildly sourish palate. Havent had this style beers in a while but this is way better than most of what Ive had, not my favorite style still.
3334
Ámbar limpio y espuma marfil ligera. Aromas de manzana dulce, ligero toque cítrico y herbal fresco. Cuerpo medio, maltoso, inicio dulce, manzana roja y final seco de amargor suave aunque largo.

Bottle 35,5cl / Botella 35,5cl.
@ LaBIRRAtorium, Madrid, España.
A: Amber / Ambar.
T/S: Malt, yeast, sweet, caramel / Malta, levadura, dulce, caramelo.
330 mml bottle tasted on the 08/02/2016. Clear, dark orange colour with minimal white head. Taste is soft sweet but dry at the finish. Some spice on the palate too. Next one please!
Draft. Pours a clear orangish color. Aroma and taste are caramel, floral, and some spices.

Bottle.

A- Caramel, bready, honey, cloves, melon.

A- Orange color, cloudy liquid, minimal head.

T- Clove, banana, honey.

P- Light body, average texture, average carbonation, soft finish.

O- Pretty solid. The aroma and flavor was overwhelmingly clove and honey with a bit of banana and melon. Balanced and easy to drink.

11.2 ounce bottle poured into a brandy snifter. The beer is a hazy copper color with a white head of velvety foam. The aroma has some musty characteristics, but the honeysuckle comes through nicely and rounds everything out nicely. The taste has nice sweetness. Moderate banana-like esthers. Some vanilla beans come through as well. Medium body. Moderate to low carbonation. One of the most enjoyable Bieres de Garde I have had that was not soured. Very well done.
Bottle at home. Aroma is floral, bready malt, banana, herbal, clove, earthy, bubblegum, fruity, apricot, yeast. Flavour is moderate sweet. Medium bodied, smooth beer. Fairly complex and tasty.

This beer is a hazy golden color with a medium white head that evaporates steadily at a film. Short strings of lacing. Aroma of herbs, malt and yeast. Medium body with flavors of floral yeast, grainy malt and fruit. The finish is floral and herbal with a yeast aftertaste. Above average overall.

12oz bottle from Supermarket Liquor 
Pours clear golden with a small white head that dissipates quickly, some light lacing. Aroma of sweet grains, floral, honey and bready. Flavors of toasted malts, earthy, tea and spices, sweet 
Good
A nice one. Sweet bread you malts with some honey, pepper brewers yeast and a touch of light fruits.

Pours a half clear gold to amber colour with small quick head. Its yeasty aroma contains banana, bubblegum with floral and spicy touch. Soft sweet in taste which reveals malt and bread with a spicy and light bitter finishing.

12 oz single bottle from Supermarket Liquors for $2.99. Clear orange appearance white a fine white head and active carbonation. Aroma of sweet caramel malt, floral notes, herbs, light rye spice, earth, rustic yeast, toasted grain, toffee and light honey. Similar flavor, adding more malt sweetness than expected, balanced by a mild bitterness. Medium body with a fizzy carbonation and light syrupy feel. An interesting beer overall.

12oz bottle into tulip - floral, leaves, earthy, caramel, toast, herbs, bubblegum, hazy, golden, amber, minimal head, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, soft carbonation, I have no prefab words for overall.

Backlog rating. Keg at Kings Arms tap takeover, London. It pours a clean dark golden color with medium off-white head. Aroma is sweet malty yeasty, with dark fruits, caramel and light esters. taste has more dark fruits, toffee, light floral yeasty notes and earth. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, good BdG
Hazy golden with a creamy white head. Aroma is Belgian malts and citrus. Taste goes smooth following the aroma notes, floral, with a very low bitterness and carbonation. Tasty and refreshing.
Essendo uno stile che non amo particolarmente, anzi, devo ammettere che questa nonostante tutto è stata una discreta bevuta.
Bottle from Bethesda Food and Beverage. Nice copper body with slight head. Nose is skunky with spelt and rye. Taste is better, malts, toasty, sweet and earthy tones. Enjoyable.
Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty spicy yeasty floral aroma. Fruity malty spicy yeasty flavor. Has a fruity malty spicy yeasty finish.

12 oz. bottle. Pours a hazy dark orange with a tight soapy white head that leaves a wispy film and collar. Aroma has sweet yeast flowers honey malty and some hidden citrus. Taste is more sweet malt yeast with a blend of honey flowers citrus and even more hidden bitterness.

From old notes. From tap at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2012. Hazy orange color with white head. Malty and yeasty aroma, spicy, funky, floral. Sweet and bitter taste. Medium oily body with soft carbonation
Pours Cloudy golden with white head. Aroma is Fruity malt with herbal and cloves yeasty notes. Flavor is sweet malt , honey,crisp citrus. Herbal notes and spicy clove yeast finish.

12oz bottle. Filtered looking orange-tan. Looks very innocuousI and regular beer-beer like. Not much of a head, some soda bubbles. This is a very nice rendition of a Bierre de Garde. Manages to capture a lot of subtle French farmhouse type tones, and also play with some oddball additions. Im not really digging the aroma, but I enjoy the overall product. Cool beer. Wouldve loved to have the one brewed at BA.

On tap at Voyager. Comes out cloudy gold with lacy white head. Aroma is earthy, understated. Flavors are floral and earthy, slight sourness, slight bitterness, with very light and slightly floral finish. A very classy brew.
It smells of tart dough. Hazy peach orange with minimal head. Big flavor herbal and grainy. Coats the mouth
Draft at the Irish Rover. Hazy gold, disappearing white head. Slight sweet nose cold from the keg. Taste honey sweet, spicey rosehips. Clean finish. Definetely Stillwater yeast.
Im not at all familiar with this style, so I dont know if its a perfect representation, or if it falls short.
Draught at Naka-Meguro taproom. Nice fruit salad bouquet, bread, funky pepper, dry finish. Good stuff, quite smooth and good pairing with food.

21 Apr 2015, bottle. yellow and a touch hazy. nose is sweet, slightly spiced, yeasty, maybe even milky. med/thin body and mildy fizzy. yeasty, sweet, slightly spiced. cant say i taste any rye but perhaps some honeysuckle. nicely pleasant, sweet, spiced. decent.

Bottle. Tall Boys, Leeds. Clear, dark orange. Minimal, white head. Lovely, toasty, bready saison character. The honeysuckle is evident. Theres a sweet, herbal edge, presumably the hyssop. Taste is soft sweet. Slowly turning light dry, and lighter bitter. Some spice on the palate. Slightly sticky. Finishes soft sweet, with a saison, bready finish. Liked this. Bit sticky, though.
Medium Amber color. Belgian lacing head. Very dry, lots of apricots and cherries. Medium body. Dry. Nice depth.

Bottle 355ml.
Pours nice golden wtih medium white head. Some lacing. Aroma is of spices, belgian yeast. Taste is of spices, bitterness, some acidity, pepper, sugar. Palate: Medium body. Medium carbonation. Overall: OK. A tad harsh.

pours clear light but bright golden with a small white cap, minimal retention and lacing. green apples and pears, light fruity tartness - lemony perhaps; flowery without being perfumey, classic stillwater yeast - spicy, astringent pepper and berry fruitiness sweetish caramel, candied grapefruit, low-fi phenols. average to light carbonation - some delicate fizz, light body - oily; very lightly tart and dry herbal-spicy finish. nice use of grains/plants/herbs with stillwaters signature. original, tasty and nicely crafted.

355ml bottle from Premier Gourmet in Buffalo, New York. Golden copper in colour with a thin white head, light lacing. The aroma is floral, spicy, fruity, light pepper. The flavour is earthy, light spice, some fruit, yeast. Finishes a little thin, fruity.

9/7/14. 750mL bottle shared by someone at a VORLAUF meeting, I believe. Golden pour with a small khaki head, mild lacing. Citrus, mild funk, doughy malts, a whiff of tartness in the aroma. Pleasant flavor, citrus, a hint at funk, pale malts, floral. Not bad.
12oz. Big floral notes mainly of heather and the honeysuckle. Flavors come sweet up front with hints of apple and pear blended with all the listed ingredients. Exactly what it is. Damn tasty too.
bottle. Hazy golden with one finger head. Medium body with a fair amount of grain. Rather light with the yeast. Quite pleasant, but somewhat lacking personality.

6th January 2015Earl Of Essex. Keg. Hazy amber beer, small pale cream colour head. Palate is light and semi dry and a little crisp. Sweetish malt base. On odd skunky floral caramel. Mild ripe fruits. Light dry finish. Odd but not unpleasant.

Pour very light orange gold. Not much head from a bottle. Sweat without being overbearing. Finishes with a refreshing aftertaste. Another great beer from Stillwater!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

gold pour some soap bubbles. Aroma grapes fusel alcohol. Tastes mostly of the malts - spicy grains, biscuits, fresh honey grandeur. Slight floral notes. Not my favorite style - this one is better than usual probably because the alcohol is approachable and light at 6.4%
Bottle pours yellow with white head. Aroma is spicy yeast and light malt. Taste is crisp malts, and dry yeast finish, easy drinking

Keg at the Earl Of Essex, 03/01/15.
Almost clear orange golden with a decent egg shell white cap that stays for the show.
Nose is bitter orange, apricot jam, straw, light yeast notes, earthy.
Taste comprises sweet citric licks, mandarin, farmy, candied orange peel, grassy, yeast esters.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with sweet and sour fruit strokes.
Decent BDG.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle from Wine Emporium 110115. Great flavour with plenty of sweet fruit aromas and flavours. Deep amber with not much in the way of a head. Very enjoyable.

bottle @ Party Town / Florence KY --- Clear medium amber with a white head cover, streaks of lace. Taste is malt that adds grass and honey in the palate, turning only a little bitter in a medium finish. An interesting brew, weighted toward the sweet.
Keg at spitfire... Light amber... Small white head.. Soft bready fruits nose... Soft fruits.. Light fruits.. Bready fruits...

Bottle. Pretty orange see through color. Aroma of citrus, yeast, spices, and wine. Maybe some pinot. Boozy. Flavor is belgian-like. Fruity and still boozy. There is some herb/floral/weed dominance in the nose and flavor. Pretty interesting.
Keg at Spitfire. Pours hazy amber, nose is estery, floral, taste is similar, dry.

white average frothy head. fair lacing. mostly diminishing. hazy thick dark yellow body. aroma: cilanter, spicy, flowers. if: moderate sweet (yeasty). ff: moderate sweet light salty; long duration. palate: light medium body, watery texture, medium carbonation, metallic finish. Enjoativa. Gosto de sabão no final da cerveja. Condimentada. Baixíssima drinkability, mesmo em duas pessoas. Pior Stillwater que já provei, de longe. 15s

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 z kranu w czeskiej baszcie. Fajnie zlozone w aromacie i w smaku - kwiaty, chleb, slod, guma do zucia, cytrusy, banan, przyprawy ... wszystkiego po trochu :) dosc tresciwe, kremowe. na tyle fajne, ze powtorzylem :)Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
Bottle @ tasting. Aroma is grainy yeasty malt and caramel, some sour malt. Flavour is quite sweet with a light sour tang and some fruits. Meh, doesnt really work.
On draft at magnolias it is a clear golden color with a slight head. The aroma is sweet like honeysuckle and the taste is cardamom with a hint of honey
On draft at Magnolias in Purcellville. Pours a clear gold with an off white head. Light biscuit nose. Flavors of banana and cardamom. Tasty.
Julie says it smells very belgiumy but is very good. It is a nice mellow not too much of a bite she gives a 3.8

Aroma is stuffed with barnhouse notes, wheat, hay, yeast, flowers and different kind of fruits. The taste is something, its easy to drink, but there are hundreds of images flowing through my mind. Its like taking a horseback ride around the farm, you start out in the stable and dusty hay is up in your face and then you ride through the vineyard with ripe sweet grapes ready for plucking, you take a turn through the wheat fields, and jumping over a hedgerow full of different flowers. You end up back at the stables, with a dry mouth from the rather exhausting and complex ride, but you feel kinda good as both you and the horse had a pretty good time.

Pours a thin head on a hazy straw body.
The aroma has lots of honey and a nice floral smell.
The taste starts with a malty sweetness, moves to an even bigger honey sweetness, finishes with a mild lemon bitter note.
The texture is light and crisp.
Its on the sweet side for me but still tasty.

Pours amber with a large fading head.
Nose shows bready malt, spicy farmhouse yeast and some soft grainy honey notes.
Flavours imitate a honey saison with amber malt. Some spicy hops and caramel. Finishes gently but well-balanced.
Bottle. Honey, butterscotch, and malt aroma. Golden yellow with small head. Sweet creamy orange and caramel malt flavor. Medium body with light carbonation. Nice.

God öl. Sticker inte ut men kan absolut ta ett par. En rustik höstöl. Hade nog hade passat riktigt bra till en gryta eller liknande. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at Good Dog. Very hazy pale orange gold pour. Fizzy white head quickly disappeared to a very thin ring. No lace. Dry yellow flowers. Dandelion. Tangerine peels. Heather. Chamomile. Hazelnut. Daisies. Maybe a bit to sweet.

Bottle:
Hazy, yellow-amber with a quick white cap.
Yeast, sugary orange aroma.
Slightly funky, very sweet orange syrup....
Floral/herb flavours.
A touch of spice.
Really nice.
Tap at Faucets. Want to try this again as I wasn't completely paying attention. Saison graininess, fruity strawberry. Very easy drinking. Good stuff.

Bottle. Rose gold, white head vanishes almost immediately. Aroma is grainy and floral (mainly heather), some stone fruit. Sweet with lots of apricot, rye, earthy and slightly tangy. Dries out a fair bit at the end. Pretty engaging.

355ml bottle. Bought 7/26/14. Pours a slightly hazy orange with a half finger, off white head that quickly thins to a ring. Aroma has big notes of candy sugar, Belgian yeast, bubble gum, cotton candy, and orange citrus. Yum! Taste is balanced. Starts out with some candy sugar, bubble gum, and a hint of tartness, then moves to citrus and a bit of bread, then ends with a short, sweeter aftertaste. Medium body with a medium-high carbonation. Very slightly syrupy in the mouth but super drinkable with a dry finish. Overall this is a great beer. Great belgian flavours with a very easy drinking mouth feel.

Stillwater Débutante has a thin, off-white head, a semi-clear, yellow-gold appearance, and fervent bubble streams. The aroma is of varied, funky spices and white bread, and the flavor is the same. Bitterness is low, here. Mouthfeel is medium, and Stillwater Débutante finishes not so dry and pleasant. RJT

From 355 ml bottle.Pours a hazy orange with a sudsy white head that collapses to a collar. Moderate carbonation. Aromas of lemon, pepper, barnyard funk and marshmallows. Taste is light fresh fruit (pear maybe) before a prickly lemon and pepper note kicks in. Creamy mouthfeel. Slides away at the end to a clean finish leaving a citrus aftertaste. Like it.
Citrus and some floral yeast. Gold pour with OK head and lacing. Some farmy hay. Light musky finish. Some sweetness. Tap at love and regret.
Aroma is yeast, very spicy and a hint of citrus/fruit. The flavor is spices, citrus, mild fruit, a small hint of heat and a mild/medium tangy finish.

Bottled. Hazy yellow beer with yeast flakes and huge pillowy head. Loads of ripe, fermented fruitiness (plums), some spiciness, orange zest, fresh yeastiness. Slight herbal notes of Heather. Round and malty taste without being sweet. Some berryish acidity in the finish. Medium body and soft, slightly oily.

Clear deep yellow poor with a nice soapy head. Aroma of slight mellow funk, bread banana and lemon zest. Very nice taste with a very pleasant mellowness tying everything together great wee hint of spice. Very nice.

12 ounce bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 5/23/2014. Pours fairly crystal clear deep golden color with a 1 finger dense white head with good retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Light spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of lemon zest, apricot, pear, apple, light banana, honey, rye bread, herbal, floral, grass, clove, pepper, and herbal/yeast earthiness. Very nice aromas with good balance and complexity of fruity/earthy yeast, bready malt, and spice notes; with good strength. Taste of lemon zest, apricot, pear, apple, light banana, honey, rye bread, herbal, floral, grass, clove, pepper, and herbal/yeast earthiness. Fair amount of earthy yeast spice on the finish; with lingering notes of lemon zest, apricot, pear, apple, light banana, clove, herbal, floral, grass, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Damn nice complexity and robustness of fruity/earthy yeast, bready malt, and spice flavors; with a great malt/yeast balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, crisp, and lightly bready mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is a damn nice Biere de Garde style. All around great complexity and balance of fruity/earthy yeast, bready malt, and spice flavors; and very smooth and crisp to drink. A very enjoyable offering.

"I definitely like the combination of rye and honey in the aroma and especially the flavor. Stillwater is interesting. They use a WIDE variety of ingredients but have a definite house flavor, and for the most part their bottled brews are overcarbonated. Pretty nice, though."

Bottle purchased at Four Firkins in St. Louis Park. Consumed in a Belgian glass purchased at Moeder Lambic. Pours a hazy golden color. Not a lot of head or lacing present but Im not going to hold that against the beer as the pour itself may have needed some improvement. Aroma has some funk to it with some mild hints of fruit. Taste is relatively light picking up some sour notes as it moves throughout the sip. Definitely reminiscent of farmhouse ales Ive sampled before especially the ones with no real need for sweetness. Has a grassy, bitter like finish but it works. I would say this is pretty good for a debutante effort.
Hazy golden appearance. Herbal and honey in the nose. Flavor is lots of pepper, earth, yeast, farmhouse funk, and lemon. Very nice. Fairly smooth mouthfeel. Nice beer.

A bit of farmhouse smell, but not in a bad way,, some haze... Taste is bold and big with hints of herbs. For me this beer taste autumn, and I like that. Goes well with mushrooms and pasta 
Not ideal for the gruyere cheese I eat right now, but it works ..

A glowing, hazed amber body displays a few carbonation streams beneath a fading off white head of large bubbles, which completely dissipates

Welcoming, rustic floral and dried herb dance over juicy citrus fruit, banana, and melon on a silky medium body with controlled, active carbonation highlighting creamy melon nuances above the other previously mentioned components in the finish and drying, semi-sweet residual

12oz bottle code 143:14 09:12 (May 23rd) purchased from cooler, and served at 45° into Orrefors Beer Taster

Bottle. Pours a golden brown color with a tan head. Pure farmhouse/saison scent with some citrus. Tastes earthy, sweet grass, cloves, citrus, and malts. Great bubbly carbonation and smooth sweet finish. Well balanced.

Turbid amber/orange appearance with a tiny off white head that could only leave modest lacing. Yeasty, tropical fruit aroma with spicy, herbal notes. Flavor is tart and sweet with the fruit still standing tall. Mild funk in the aftertaste chased by black pepper. Medium bodied, decently carbonated mouthfeel with a lingering finish.

Bottle. Nose is very light, somewhat sweet with strange wheat (?) [ed. - spelt] Pours hazy gradient between golden and yellow, short off-white head. Taste lightly sweet and probably blander than most Ive had from still water, theres lemony citrus character and gummy wheatishness in a full body, closer to flat than crisp but not a boring mouthfeel. Some faint floral character, heather and lavender, as well as faint spice (though Im not going to say coriander, because its not) and malt. Not really any bitterness, tart/tang is faint, touch of honey-sugar and a faint herbal feel. There is balance here, there is refreshment and good cheer, just no hops or botanical adjuncts to add that extra layer of depth. Still would have it again, no doubt!

Pours a golden yellow with a foamy white head. Aroma is honey and spice. Flavor is more on the spice end, but lacking for the most part. The beer grew on me a little as I drank it, but overall its not too memorable.

Bottle from BOTW. Cloudy gold with lace. Interesting spicy nose, lemon, honey, bread, herbs. Flavor is sweet honey lemon with herbs, along with wheaty spelt and maybe a bit of rye. Nice tartness to balance, and decent spicy bitterness and tang. Crisp and medium body. Good.

P: Golden orange with almost no head. S: Strong smell, lots of herbs, lime, malt, salt, and lavender. T: Grains, light stone fruits, lime, and herbs in the end. M: Crispy with medium carbonation. O: Rather unique beer.

12oz picked up at 5 points bottle shop. Pours a hazed golden orange with thin white head. Smell is sweet spicy malty, esters of clove and light banana. Taste is is more clove and banana with the carbonation really pulling the flavors through nicely with some biscuity malt.

12oz bottle from Marinos in Toledo. Orange pour with visible carbonation and an off - white head. Aroma of banana, sweet bread and spice. Tastes earthy, tropical fruit, honey, hay, yeasty, light pepper, floral, saison-y. Ends up easy drinking overall though I couldnt place it within the style for lack of experience. 7.2
Short white head over a clowdy golden beer. Nice aroma from ripe pears and a tuch of belgian phenols. Dry and fruity taste.

Bottle from Systembolaget, bought in February 2014. 

Hazy golden/orange with a small head. Fairly sweet with yeast, fruit and light spices. Also some funk. Relaxed and easy to drink.

You couldnt as for much more on the pour, this is a really impressive looking beer.  The aroma is solid, though a touch muted, but those notes really come out in the flavor.  Overall, this one works quite nicely.

4oz pour at Maxs Belgian Fest.  Double dry hopped and on cask.  Pours a hazy, dark orange with zero head.  Nose is very juicy, kiwi, kumquat, lemon, grapefruit, herbal.  Standard Stillwater herb smell.  Flavor is sweet, kumquats, white pepper, green bell pepper.  Finishes kind of thin and soapy.

on tap  Amber beer with an off-white head. Yeast and earth aroma with spice. Yeast and citrus flavor with spice and earth. Medium bodied. Citrus and yeast lingers with light floral notes, light spice, and earth

750ml bottle in a tulip.  Pours amber with a lacy, off-white head.  Aroma of light fruits, some caramel and pale malts, and floral hops.  Flavor the same with a little spiciness too.  Average texture.  A pretty good beer for the style.
UPDATED: MAR 12, 2013 Bottle.  Pours fairly clear orange with medium head.  An interesting beer with flowery and herbal notes and some earthy notes as well.
Bottle. Pours a hazy golden color with white head. Cheese, brett, barnyard aromas. Tart, citrus, refreshing flavor.

Bottle in hotel room St. Louis picked up at Wine and Cheese. Pours a cloudy, yellow appearance with a white head. Very nice bretty, pineapple, lemon, mango, vanilla, coconut aroma. Soft mouth feel. Slightly metallic, tart lemon, pineapple flavor with an odd, metallic, spicy malty finish. The finish is a big turn off and actually kind of hard to describe the issue.

Bottle - Grassy hops, yeast, bread, hay and some sweet citrus.  Clear orange with a long lasting foamy head.  Almost no bitterness, some alcohol and a pervasive sweetness that cloys in the finish.  Banana, apricot and if I took a long time I could name more fruit as it is quite complex.  Very effervescent, I can feel the bubbles in my nose.  Nice beer but the sweetness is a bit too much for me.

P:  A huge creamy peak of mountainous meringue head that billows on top of a unrelentingly murky body of dark apricot.  Retention is outstanding. The creamy film never goes away and delicate lace clings to the glass. 

S:  Aroma is floral with bountiful rye notes, honeysuckle, soapy yeast, musty cardboard, white grapes, and spicy wheat.  Reminds me of the decorative floral bath soap by grandma used to have when I was a child. 

T/M:  Spices are more upfront than the nose.  Earthy, floral and fruity with a timid kiss of hop bitterness. Honeysuckle is prominent with powdery yeast and rustic wheat gracing the creamy, yet prickly body. Finish is very dry with spicy and floral bite. Bartlett pears and ground black pepper linger afterwards. 

O:  Debutante is my first Stillwater offering and i can say I am eager to try more. Aggressively earthy and floral with hearty wheat, spices and a kiss of fruit.   Wonderfully complex and well blended saison. What a great introduction to Stillwater ales.
Bottle. Pours orange gold with white head. Nose/taste of citrus fruits, farmhouse yest, lemongrass, grapefruit, honeycomb and florals. Medium body. Dryish finish.

750 ml. bottle- Pours very hazy orange with a pillowy white head that reduces to a blanket of foam. Aroma is spices, maybe heather, definitely honeysuckle, I remember honeysuckle from when I was a kid, sucking out what little juice was in those bug infested flowers, it also has a basic beer or ale aroma. The taste is very foamy, yeasty, all those spices are there, but it is hard to pinpoint each one. Body is medium, carbonation is high. Overall this was good, It isnt anything you have to run out and buy this second, but if you do stumble across it, give it a tumble, not bad!
Je suis vraiment pas un fan de ce genre de bière aux notes de cidre bien sucré. La conception semble impeccable mais cest loin dêtre dans ma palette.
A really great citrus nose on this tawny beer. Good mix of sparkle and funk on this one. Somewhat reminiscent of orange pekoe tea without the acidity. Some spice notes at the back.

Pours a clear golden/amber with a large pillowy head. Aroma is yeast, rye, bananas. Taste is very well balanced. Not overdone on the farmhouse funk and smooth creamy mouthfeel. Good beer. Interested in trying more from this brewer.

Sampled from a 750 ml brown bottle this beer poured a murky apricot color with a small white head that left moderate lacing. The aroma was sweet pineapple, papaya, ginger, sugar, orange and perfume. The flavor was sweet hot candied sugar, tropical fruits, orange and sugar. Long tangy candied tropical fruits and ginger finish. Moderately full bodied. Excellent.
Pours an amber color with big tan head.  Aroma is hay, toast, spices, and bananas.  Taste is spicy and malty with a nice rich creamy mouthfeel.
UPDATED: NOV 6, 2012 This is good, takes a while to warm up, herbal and floral, a malty Saison.

750 ml.  Poured hazy straw/pale gold with a huge white head that left some lacing.  Aroma was quite floral with some spicy, peppery, and rye notes.  Flavor was fairly bitter, moderately yeasty with some woody, spicy notes.  Medium mouthfeel.
Nice Belgian. Pours a golden amber with thick head. Must Belgian aroma with some spicy underneath. Very creamy Belgian. Rich and nice. Very enjoyable.
Bottle. Pours a honey yellow. Aroma is a nice musty Belgian spice. Taste is very nice and clean but with a very hefty substance to it. Nice bdg

750 ml bottle. Pours hazy orange-gold with a large cream-colored pillowy head that takes its sweet time receding; soapy lacework sheets the glass. Aroma consists of creamed corn, dust, floral (honeysuckle, for sure), perfume, grain (rye?). Taste is lightly sweet and minty, crisp and refreshing. Very tasty...I like that hyssop in there.

Picked this up at Hunger mountain Co-Op. Sort of a hazy brown orange with hints of amber. 3 finger head off-white. Nose is a bit spicy, some honey and some odd oaky characters maybe a hint of tropical fruits. Taste is Sweet up front, cane sugar and peppers. Very interesting taste and not all that amazing.

Bottle: Poured a cloudy bright golden color ale with a super large foamy head with good retention and some excellent lacing. Aroma of rye and spelt malt is easily detectable with some good notes of rustic ester and light residual sugar notes. Taste is a complex mix between some fruity ester with good notes rustic malt with spicy notes of rye malt and light residual sugar notes. Body is full with limited filtration and good carbonation and no apparent alcohol. Very well brewed with excellent level complexity while retaining a very nice level of drinkability.

Hazy golden color with a nice white head. Aroma is floral and fruity with a hint of apples. Flavor is a light floral fruitiness almost like a cider but without the overwhelming sweetness and tartness. Finishes clean with some nice light yeast. Playful and enjoyable.
Darker side fo a biere de garde. Pretty standard flavors. light maltiness, herbal hops and yeast. Pleasant but not special.

Bottle. Pours hazy gold without too much of a head (surprisingly for a Stillwater beer) but still a light head and plenty of nose tickling carbonation. Slightly funky, sweet/spice aroma. Taste is earthy, spicy, slightly sweet with a bit of tropical fruit that lingers on the tongue. Sticky mouthfeel. Overall a good balance.

Beautiful example of a farm house ale with added character and class.  The nose really carries the grains and herbs with a lovely citrus common for the style.  Lightly sweet, lightly sour with a medium body makes this a perfect summer brew.

Draught at Breukelen Bier Merchants Stillwater event.  Clear yellow beer.  Theres a strange egg with slight sulfer aroma that is fairly unpleasant...but doesnt completely ruin the beer.  Aromas a light cream, honey, floral, and what I thought was wheat but must be the spelt. The flavor is slightly tart, low bitterness, moderately sweet. The mouthfeel is tangy.  Its really nice and very refreshing...other than that odd sulfer thing.

In short: A semi-rustic, yeasty and dusty dark blonde ale.  Nice 
How: Bottle 750ml.  Consumed fresh the day of purchase
The look: Cloudy dark blonde body topped by a medium off-white head with medium retention
In long: Nose is like smelling an old dusty rug over sun dried hay and dried orange peels and flowers.  Taste is similar. A very yeasty beer with a dusty character, dried fruits, lots of dried flowers, a bit of acidity, a fun spciness.  All that served over dry salted crackers.  There is a Saison-ish rusticity happening with the yeast but Carbonation is very very lively, borderline aggressive.  Nice beer.  Im entering this rating late, it is past midnight, and if you are reading this right now I know why you are still awake, stop it, youre gross.

My Bottom Line :  
Multiple herbs and cereals whirl around this farmhouse brews rustic profile, as citrusy notes get catapulted by excited effervescence.

Further Personal Perceptions :  
-A sheet of foam caps the cloudy amber.
-Rye is more apparent to me than spelt in this brew.
-This is pretty drinkable once you get used to the rusticity.
-There is A LOT of yeast in the bottle. Hard to pour a decent second glass.
-This is not unlike Hopfenstarks Saison Station 16.

Bottle.
25.4 oz. Bottle. Bready banana custard scent, toffee, and citrus. Copper pour with a bubbly head. Light body, fizzy, bubbly feel. Bready custard to citrus to bitter flavor.

750mL bottle.  Poured light-medium orange with a well-retained white head.. sticky lacing followed it down.  The aroma picked up dusty bread, dried fruits, and a lovely bouquet of floral notes.. a little rye, orange zest, and honeysuckle right on the back.. quite nice.  The flavor found bread and honeyed malts at the core, with floral notes (some slightly sour), herbs, and earthy spices around.. very dry with oaky notes, cloves, and fruity zest on the finish.  Medium-bodied with moderate-plus carbonation on the palate.. spicy and engaging, with a lot of yeasty character.. nice one.

Floral aroma suggests more complexity than is revealed. Strong malty carbonation, crisp and slight sweetness fades on the palate quickly. Full mouthfeel and palate. Lingering and weak notes of citrus and hops. Decent, but leaves you wanting more...
Draft. Nice floral aroma. Decent head and amber beer. The heather etc is not overpowering at all and just add a little extra complexity. All round pretty tasty.

5/1/12 bottle. golden orange with a small white head...after initial explosive foamy business.

smells peachy and malty sweet...along with some mustiness, earth, peppery spice, herbs and cooked fruits.

the flavor shares the same notes...but adds a rather sweet palate, some nuttiness/yeast, tingly hoppiness and a distinct tartness on the finish. the herbaceous quality is hard to pin down and is weird...though not bad.

its medium to fuller bodied but luckily the spiciness helps out. 6.5/3/6.5/3/14

Bottle at the condo in Tahoe, from a wine glass. Pours cloudy cpper/gold, thick white head, spotty lacing. Nose is spicy, with apricot, pumpkin, funk, white pepper, spicebox, and earth. Flavours of banana, lemon, peach; very dry, very earthy. Tart to cheesy palate with big earth towards the finish. Nice.

Tap @ Parkway. Hazy gold pour with a moderate, fine-bubbled white head with good retention and leaving moderate lace. Nose is lightly herbal and funky. Medium-light body and moderate, fine carbonation. The rye is apparent but not oppressive, as are the herbal adjuncts. There is also a light spiciness, with some clove, banana, white pepper and coriander. Lovely, dry Biere de Garde with just enough funkiness and body to be noticeable, but never in your face - balance is excellent. Finish is short and dry, and it leaves you wanting more. Superb.

Draft Murky apricot-colored ale with a small, wispy, white head. Excellent retention. The aroma furnishes some very nice funk, underripe apricot, coriander, salt and unmalted rye. Medium-bodied and milky with firm carbonation. The flavor is almost equal parts funky, tangy and sweet  just a slight nod toward the sweet side of balance. Notations of old cheese, apricot, coriander, peach and delicate pale malt. Lengthy, lightly sweet, mildly spicy and herbal finish. Very nice beer enjoyed in the perfect setting at Of Love & Regret - Pub and Provisions in Baltimore.

Tap at The Bridge St Louis, MO June 2012-Pours hazy orange with a small soapy rocky white head.  nose is very floral-ripe fruits, banana lots of tripel-ish qualities, lite funk with some spice alongside.  some oaky tones as well.  WOW, some cool flavors here-lots of banana, spice, dry yeast qualities, GOP and ginger.  finish has lots of ginger undertones-this is very good!  lots of character here with a lively palate, which i usually dont like from this brewery, however it works here.  Pleasant very dry finish.  One of the better beers from this brewery!

On tap at Vedge, Philly.  Served in a champaigne-like flute.  Pours an interesting hazy, light orange with a tinge of pink.  About an inch and a half of frothy white head.  Mildly funky and dry flower aroma.  Mouthfeel was overcarbonated, light and semi-dry.  Taste was very much like a typical saison.  Light, dry, funky with plenty of hops.  Flowers were present too.  Overall, it was a very nice beer but there are plenty of those.  Well done but run-of-the-mill saison.  At Stillwaters price point (I paid $9 for a 10-12oz pour) not nearly worth it.

draft at Farmhouse Tavern, Chicago.  hazed gold body with a fine white head.  nose of dried orange peel and arugula with husky / grainy pale malt and light touches of herbs / flowers.  similar flavor with a light off-note of wet cork / soggy wood. heavy nuttiness develops, its something like seared / burnt oily peanuts and cashews.
On tap at blue monk buffalo, pours slightly hazy gold capped by a silky off white head with good retention. Nose and taste feature pepper, herbs and flowers. Slightly musty but drying mouth.

Enjoyed on-tap @ The Bridge Tap House & Wine Bar in St. Louis, MO for $9. Tapped from the "Dark" Looking Tap Handle from Stillwater into a 12oz Pint Glass. Stillwaters 750mL bottles are ALWAYS over $15 so I decided to try this on-tap first.

Aroma- Tons of complexity comes from this brew. Huge spices and a fresh/fruit blend is included. Bit of clove as well. Super potent! 

Appearance- Received with a 1.5 finger head that has good head retention. Has a deep golden colored body but clear. Leaves thick frothing behind. 

Flavor- VERY malty and almost a deep grain flavor from the beginning.  Spices then come in with a bit of pepper and then prickles at the finish with slight bitterness. 

Mouthfeel- Light-Medium Bodied, High Carbonation, Effervescent, Sweet Spices, and then a mixed fruit flavor finishes on the palate. 

Overall Impression- A decent Saison by Stillwater/Brewers Art but not worth the price... I havent seen this in bottle shops yet but wont be looking to purchase it.  Not even taste/flavor for me. The spices were a good contribution to the beer but needed more character.

Draft at Jerrys. Hazy orange-gold with good, creamy, white head / Light, sweet nose of tropical fruit and straw / Medium body, moderately sweet and fruity, with mild (and insufficient) hop balance, and hint of bitterness on finish / Simple flavors of pineapple, orange, passion fruit, and straw / Mediocre.

30/06/2012 Ma che siete venuti a fà (tap). Ambrata scarica, pesca, molto torbida, schiuma bianca abbondante e persistente. Al naso sentori di luppolo, lieviti e spezie, note erbacee leggere. In bocca è morbida ed equilibrata, si lascia bere bene, ha corpo medio e carbonazione soft. Buona.

Tasty pint, mild and yeasty with a pilsner-ish finish.  Pours hazy and lovely. The nose is weak, giving up a little yeast and an unnameable herb, but only in a fleeting way.  Tastes nice, slightly sweet and hefe-like at first, only to then turn dry and brisk and charming, with a mild yet noticeable hop fade.  Wish I had time for another.

Tap at Of Love & Regret, cloudy goldenrod pour with a tight, white head (like all of Brians beers!). Funky, skunky nose.  Taste is yeasty and sweet like Heather and honeysuckle.  crisp hop finish and medium palate.

Sehr bananiger Beginn, der zum Glück nicht übertrieben süß ist, da die Herbe gegenwirkt. Süffig, die Herbe steigt in ihrer Wichtigkeit. Süßlich, bananig, angenehme Hopfenbitterkeit. Ausgewogenes Bier mit schön verteilten Aromen. 11/12/12/10//11

Draught at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen, Denmark. Murky orange, medium white head. Earthy, yeasty and fruity aroma with bananas and peaches. Medium bodied, soft carbonation. Semi sweet, medium bitterness.
Flaske: Gulorange helt uklar øl med et fint skumhoved. Duften er meget krydret, belgisk. Med en smule humle. SMagen er igen krydret som en belgier. Fin øl med en tand syrlighed.

Peach and pear nose, a fair amount of funk. Cloudy amber, medium head.  Flavor id funky, bordering on rubbery. Dominant notes are peach and lemongrass. Lemongrass is especially prominent in the finish. Well made and delicious beer, but lacks the malty sweetness of a biere de garde. Another solid saison from Stillwater, more likely.

Philly Beer Week is too short. Had this on the sidewalk at Hawthornes. Pours a light amber with a small head. The aroma is sweet malt with some fruit and grass. the flavor is sweet and sour, very dry and refreshing.

25 oz bottle.   Pours a clear light copper body with a one finger fizzy off-white head that retained well due to the vigorous visible carbonation.  The nose is very light and delicate with a slight floral note.  Almost perfume like with the botanicals used.  Cant say that I get a whole lot of rye in here, but there is a nice spiciness that doesnt seem to come from the botanicals as well.  The flavor is also very light and delicate, lots of floral perfumey notes on the finish.  Fairly dry and crisp as far as the body goes, though I could do with a lot less fizziness than is going on here.  Nice, delicate, and very light for the ABV.  I like it.

Brilliant label. 750 ml bottle. Poured cloudy without head. Stone fruits throughout, some tartness, earthy notes, green apple. This is a good beer. The yeast character dominates, but the fruitiness helps to balance the spicy nature of the yeast. Well done.

Pours deep hazy gold into a tulip. Off-white micro head with good retention recedes leaving trailing sheets. Sweet honey and rye aromas. Sharp with sweet honey and caramel upfront turning slightly tart before the lasting bitter pepper finish.

Another winner from Stillwater.  Pours cloudy golden / orange with a medium sized off-white head.  The aroma is quite herbal with gently dry spices, earthy cellar must, lively spice, white pepper, some rye and ripe fruit - quite complex and interesting.  Medium crisp body that has lively mouth filling and frothy carbonation.  The flavor starts with a really nice blend of fresh bright herbal qualities, mustiness, spicy rye, bold spices ~ dont know heather and hyssop well enough to point out, but its probably them.  While having some must it is still very refreshing and clean finish.  Excellent beer and nice take on a biere de garde.

Tap @ CBC. Hazy golden yellow with a massive white head. The nose is light clove and coriander, yeasty infected banana, springwater freshness. The taste is sweet celery, more juicy banana, fresh hop and cracked wheat. General light grain and floral notes. The bodys light, the carbonation is soft. Overall, quite pleasant.

750ml bottle served in a tulip. Poured a hazy gold with a finger of white head. Floral aroma that I wasnt really a fan of. Also some citrus. Light bodied with plenty of carbonation. Nice and dry with some Belgian spice in the finish. More citrus in the flavor. Taste was better than the aroma. Not my favorite Stillwater.

Tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration, 2012. Slightly hazy deep golden with small white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, yeast, hops, citrus and spices. Flavour is malt, medium sweet, hops, yeast, spices, citrus, little sweet and a little bitter.
Bottle. Pour is cloudy golden with small white head. Aroma and flavor loadEd with orange peel, light spice, faint light malt and a clean peppery finish. Really nice.
CBC. Hazy dark yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, fruity, yeasty and light spicy. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Sweet finish. 110512

This pours amber with an orange hue and white head. The aroma is too light to identify much, light orange citrus and vague sweet malts. The flavor is similar, lighter body with wheat like light malty ale flavors and and a blander ending.

Had this on tap at Churchkey about two weeks ago. Poured an orange color, medium sized white head. Aroma was rye spice, with notes of floral notes, bready yeast. Flavor was spicy, with earthy notes to it. A slightly dry finish. Well made, but not exactly my thing.

Tap. Pours hazy orange with thin, fizzy white head; short retention and minimal lacing. Aroma is orange, lemon, grassy hops, herbs, cereal and straw malt, with light floral notes. Flavor is malt forward with great supporting citrus esters and hops; crisp, dry finish. Light body, medium carbonation, and low warmth.

Pours thick extremely turbid orange juice color with 2-finger frothy white head.  Nose is dry floral, coriandery spice, some spelt and citrus.  Tastes dry, floral, spicy, with some limey citrus and peppery notes.
I have it at pizza Paradiso in Dupont. I really like it, have not taken notes that day. I want to get it soon.
Draft at prohibition with pat. Pours a bright hazy yellow amber with white creamy lacing. Aroma is honey and sweet malts. Mouthfeel is creamy with notes of malts, honey, light floral flavors.

Tap. Pours cloudy gold/copper with a small off-white head, some retention/no lace. Aroma of bread, fruity esters, toast, light floral/grassy hops. Taste is sweet, earthy, bread, yeasty, light citrus. Palate is somewhat dry, average carbonation, oily, sweet finish.

From tap. Cloudy golden with small white head. Smells malty with light spices and some earth. Taste has a med wheat body, with some spice, citrus, and light herbs. Low carbonation. After taste is wheayt, with the same initial tastes. This is a very easy going brew, but its not bad.

Bottle. Pours a hazy golden amber with a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a good amount of light fruit with a strong grain note with some hay and a hint of veggie. Flavor starts with a good amount of grains that have a bit of backing cookie and a hint of fruits and veggies.

Bottle 750ml.Hazy matt medium orange colour with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted, fruity, moderate yeasty. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a long duration, fruity, apricot, yeasty. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft and fizzy. [20120202]

UPDATED: NOV 1, 2012 Bottle.

Light pour, white head, good lacing. Funky, slightly sour, herb garden aromas. Fairly light flavor, indeed BdG more than saison. Nice but not exceptional. Still, Im happy that such beers are being brewed here....

Bottle -750mL crowned. Slightly hzaed amber with a tall fading white head. Flowery and sweet aroma with soft spice, ripe fruit, soft grains and abundant yeast notes. Soft straw as well. Taste is mostly sweet with a soft dusting of yeast atop fresh cut flowers, straw, grains, sweet malt, light spice, faint earthiness and a touch of honey. Body is light-medium with a strong, bubbly carbonation. Finishes with a touch of bitterness amongst the sweet malt, ripe fruits, dusty yeast, straw, soft earthiness, and floral notes.

Sampled at Brewvival 2012.  Clear light amber pour with ring of offwhite head. Sweet light citrus nose.  Flavor is sweetness up front with a floral, but not perfumey, quality.  A semi bitterness and drying finish.  but truthfully, I didnt think this was anything overly special.
On tap at Monks Kettle.  Pours a golden-orange with white head.  Aroma of spice and nice grain.  Great flavor of spice and floral hops as well.  Very nice.

Thanks to Jecker aka Josh for bringing this one to our IPA day party.

A - Pours hazy golden yellow with a nice one and a half finger tall white head leaving little to no lace down the glass.

S - Smells of spicy yeast, light funk, grassy hops, blackboard chalk, and some light fruitiness; mostly pear.

T - Starts off with a big dose of spicy yeast slowly giving way to a mix of grassy hops, light fruit, musty basement funk, and some chalk dust. The finish is a mix of chewy/spicy yeast and some light funk, lingering on the pallet for some time.

M - Medium body and flavor with moderate carbonation. Spicy, smooth, feel with a bit of funk toward the very end that lingers on the pallet for some time.

O - Not too bad. I still prefer some of their other saisons but this one was still ver good. Glad I got to try it. Thanks again Josh!
Bottle at Papsøs - Thanks. Cloudy golden - white head. Soapy, spicy, wheaty, citrus, honey notes, thyme, medium spicy, nice medium carbonation.

Bottle at Papsø.
Hazy amber coloured with a medium sized white head.
Fruity and spicy aroma with notes of liquorice and yeast.
Fruity flavour of spices with notes of grass.
Hoppy finish.

bottle at papso tasting.
cloudy yellow, large off-white head.
mild flowery aroma, Belgian yeast. flavor is fruity, bozoy.

UPDATED: JUL 13, 2012 75 cL bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is dry peppery and phenolic. Toasted malty and light vegetable touch. Ends slight phenolic and caramelish smooth. Medium dry.6-3-6-3-13=3.1

From tap. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is peppery, yeasty and light fruity. Smooth, bitter and light fruity, bitter and yeasty dry. Bitterand dry finish. Dry and phenolic finish.6-3-7-3-13=3.2
bottled. Amber coloured. Hazy. Dense beige head. Aroma of sterin, sweetness, spice, grass. Flavour of yeast, sweetness, flowers and some fruits. Medium bodied. Dry yeasty and sweet end. nice.

Bottled. An unclear dark golden beer with a lazing off-white head. The aroma has notes of dusty hops, fruits, and malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of peaches, and other fruits, dusty hops, and some spices, leading to bitter finish.

UPDATED: MAY 21, 2012 Bottle at Papsø - thanx. Hazy golden beer with a white foamy head. Floral, citrussy aroma with notes of yeast, fresh abricots and fruits. Taste is medium sweet and bitter with an astringent note. Very crisp, creamy texture, albeit lively carbonated. Lovely - as usual for Stillwaters brews. 
Draught at CBC. As above. Wonderfully smooth mouthfeel. Crisp, dry finish. Balance

Bottle 75 cl. Courtesy of GT2. Pours a cloudy opaque golden with a white head. Sweey peppery and spicy nose. Medium body, sweet fruit, yeast and subtle, friendly phenols. Has a slightly tart edge. No real bitterness. Very easygoing. 020212
Bottle @ Papsoe tasting. Medium head with medium duration. Color is hazy golden. Aroma and taste are sweet fruits, flowers, malt, hops and yeast. Lively carbonation.
pours orange with an acidic/sour aroma. Flavor starts off like banana and finishes bitter.

(750ml bottle)  Pours a cloudy golden orange body with a tall rocky off-white head.  Aroma of yeast, pepper, barnyard, peach, and florals.  Flavor of yeast, orange, florals, peach, dried apricot, nuts, and toasted grain with lively carbonation.  Superb.

Appearance:  deep orangey gold, with a huge, creamy billowing white head and tons of lace.   Aroma: malty sweetness, notes of citrus, herbs, yeast and light funk.   Taste: notes of slightly spicy malt, with yeast, some fruit and herbs.   Finish: sweet, lightly floral, with a bit of honeyed dryness.   Notes: I like both these breweries quite a bit, and this clearly came out well.  It had the bready sweet note I come to expect from Brewers Art, with the quality farmhouse ale characteristics you look for from Stillwater.  Nicely balanced, with interesting herbal and spice notes.
On draft at the Thirsty Monk, Asheville. Offered as a saison. Poured cloudy gd with mild lacing. Light citrus, floral. Peppery finish. Very good.
Bottle.  Hazy orange with off white head.  Bread, black pepper, lightly sweet fruit, hay, citrus, and flowery hops.  A nice drinkable ale.
Lighty sweet, doughy nose with lots of fresh baked bread and a bit of honey. The taste is very lightly sweet, lightly bitter with soft and doughy malt, hay and herbs, light floral hops.

Appearance: Pours out a hazed, orange-hued body with a tall, frothing, off-white head.

Smell: Modestly malty on the nose, a roundabout sniff of porridge garnished with citrus, with underlying fruity, spicy, floral notes throughout.

Taste: Lightly sweetish honeyed-hay maltiness, a tiny squirt of fresh lemon, and then some inviting, varied floral aspects as a pleasant, balancing peppercorn spiciness (from the grains, yeast, and spice additions) rolls in. Then, some ripe orchard fruits and a half-stick of Juicy Fruit. A wee pinch of nutmeg, mint leaf. Grows fruitier, more floral, and, even a bit more sweet as it warms. Drying finish, well carbonated with a bit of tarrying spice.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied. Medium-high carbonation.

Overall: Good blend of flavors, categorically crisp, and no more alcohol than was ever needed, keeping it tasty and refreshing (even in late December).

Pours a hazy golden with a creamy white head that left lacing.  Aroma of citrusy notes, heather and honeysuckle.  Lots of citrus coming through...guessing maybe some  American hops at work here.  Flavor of honey, some floral notes, lots of citrus, hint of rye.  Mostly dry with a touch of sweetness which just seems appropriate for this one.  Nicely done.

25.4 oz bottle.  Cloudy orange yellow with a thin white frosting.  Nose is husky, light sweetness, rye and citrus.  Medium light, slightly oily, soft carb.  Taste is bubblegum, hints of tomatillo, sweet heather and dry rye.

Source: Brusin Ales, Asheville NC
Appearance: opaque orange, fine off white head
Aroma: sweet and fruity aroma, light spicyness
Flavor: sweet fruity flavor, grape jelly fruityness, hint of spicyness
